column4: Help! I want to install Ubuntu over my current Arch, but booting from USB drive only loads the bootloader from my disk! How should I get around this?
Change your boot priority to prioritize USB over Harddrive
nit-wit: I am booting from the USB device, no doubt, but I still end up at the GRUB from my disk
What computer are you using? What did you make it with?
nit-wit Im using a Lenovo laptop, and I did press F12, and it tells me Im loading the USB drive, it reads Ubuntu and all that, and then I end up at my local GRUB
What did you make it with? Just copying the files over?
Just out of curiousity, why do you want to install ubuntu?
nit-wit Using win32diskimager, and creating a bootable USB... worked for Arch before...
Have you done an MD5sum check of the ISO?
Just temp for the weekend, dont have a working Arch and need Ubuntu to play music and stuff :)
I would also advise unetbootin as nit-wit suggested
nit-wit Yeah it might be the USB creator who messes up
I think it's either your USB creator or the ISO integrity
Do you not have any DVDs? As a last resort?
No :(
New place, havent moved 100% yet :P
Ahh ok
nit-wit unetbootin didn't make a difference :( This is so wierd, it's like I can't boot from anything else
You have done a USB install before right?
Also have you tried redownloading the ISO?
Worked with USB loader before, yes, but never tried while I had Arch installed
Do an MD5 check on the ISO
Yeah, redownloading now, will check
